definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: It was their farewell message as they signed off. Stay Hungry. Stay Foolish. And I've always wished that for myself.
sentences.chinese: 那是他們親筆寫下的告別訊息，我總是以此自許。

sentences.english: Each copy of the 336-page book is signed by the author.
sentences.chinese: 每一本336頁的書都有作者的親筆簽名。

sentences.english: I asked someone for their autograph?
sentences.chinese: 上一次向某人要親筆簽名？
蒂娜得到了詹克蒂恩的親筆簽名。

sentences.english: What a surprise, Theresa returns a reciprocal gift to Kenny – her hand drawing a cutie tiger.
sentences.chinese: 傅穎也禮上往來，送上可愛的親筆老虎畫。

sentences.english: It looked like the perfect cursive script from the credits of I Love Lucy.
sentences.chinese: 草書的筆跡像是《我愛露西》演員親筆所寫。

sentences.english: For instance, Diana's autograph has appreciated by 580% over the last 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 例如，她的親筆簽名在過去10年間增值了580%。

sentences.english: Raided and personal letter touched the nerve of cadres.
sentences.chinese: 突襲檢查和親筆信觸動了幹部的神經。

sentences.english: For instance, Diana's autographhas appreciatedby 580% over the last 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 例如，她的親筆簽名在過去10年間增值了580%。

sentences.english: Pershing is even more valuable than the stamps.
sentences.chinese: 還有，潘興將軍的親筆信比那些郵票更貴重。

sentences.english: The excuse must be in writing, and it must be verifiable.
sentences.chinese: 免考申請必須親筆書寫並經過確認。

sentences.english: I've got lots of famous footballers' autographs .
sentences.chinese: 我有許多着名足球運動員的親筆簽名。

sentences.english: Some have sent hand-drawn illustrations and funny photos.
sentences.chinese: 一些人郵來了自己的親筆繪畫和滑稽照片。

sentences.english: In his own words, here are 10 life lessons he has learthe last 40 years.
sentences.chinese: 以下是他親筆寫的過去40年來他的十條人生經驗。

sentences.english: I'm hoping to see them and get their autographs.
sentences.chinese: 我希望見到他們並且得到他們的親筆簽名。

sentences.english: He gave me a painting with his name subscribed.
sentences.chinese: 他送給我一張他親筆署名的繪畫。

definition: Zhang Xueliang (1901-2001) son of Fengtian clique warlord, then senior general for the Nationalists and subsequently for the People's Liberation Army
to sign (one's name with a pen etc)/to autograph/signature
rough sketch (of a painting)/(of an official) to approve a document by signing it
to include (in a collection)/to put together (stories, poems etc)/to record/to employ/to recruit
